response:
The tree costs \$90 up front and generates a net profit of \$7.5 each year (7 lemons × \$1.5 – \$3 maintenance).  
We need the smallest integer \(n\) such that  

\[
n \times 7.5 > 90
\]

Solving:  

\[
n > \frac{90}{7.5} = 12
\]

Thus, after 12 years the cumulative profit is exactly \$0. The first year when he actually starts earning profit is the **13th year**.

#### 13
